comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Enter: function f(k) { return k(k); } alert(f(f)) 2. Select ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS 3. Compile What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I am unsure what the desired output would be as the expression won't terminate but I received the following stack trace: 23: java.lang.RuntimeException: INTERNAL COMPILER ERROR. Please report this problem. Fixed point loop exceeded the maximum number of iterations. at com.google.javascript.jscomp.Compiler.throwInternalError(Compiler.java:2168) at com.google.javascript.jscomp.PhaseOptimizer$Loop.process(PhaseOptimizer.java:422) at com.google.javascript.jscomp.PhaseOptimizer.process(PhaseOptimizer.java:215) ... What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Closure Compiler web UI, Google Chrome, Mac OS X 10.8.5
I assume this is the function inliner going crazy.

If you want to try your hand at a fix, the first step is probably to create a unit test reproducing the bug in:
https://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/source/browse/test/com/google/javascript/jscomp/InlineFunctionsTest.java

Then we'll need to think of how to improve the inlining heuristic.

i posted a fix here:
https://codereview.appspot.com/43490046/
This issue was closed by revision 1d5246873fe8.
